page.title: 15CHICHESTER-LOCAL INTEREST 1
page.content: An ancient city, Chichester has much of architectural & historic interest. The Chichester entrenchments running North from the city are the earliest man-made remains.Flint-faced walls now occupy the site inherited from the Romans, clearly defining the old city boundaries. In Priory Park is a mound, all that remains of the Norman motte & bailey castle. Here too is the Guildhall, originally a part of a Greyfriars monastery & now part of the {Chichester and District Museum.}Beyond the city walls is {Jubilee Park} with trees planted for Queen Victoria's Jubilee. In the narrow city streets are houses & shops faced in brick and flint with Georgian facades and their fire marks still in place.{The Ship {Hotel}in North Street, once a private house, was the venue for a dinner attended by{Eisenhower}prior to{D-Day.
